meanings.definition: The first principles of a subject.
meanings.sent1: She struggled to understand the rudiments of algebra.
meanings.sent2: Learning the rudiments of cooking is essential for beginners.
meanings.sent3: Trying to teach a cat the rudiments of physics would be quite a challenge!
meanings.sent4: The rudiments of language are like building blocks for communication.
meanings.sent5: The teacher made sure to cover the rudiments of history before diving into advanced topics.

meanings.sent1: He mastered the rudiments of carpentry through practice.
meanings.sent2: The rudiments of swimming include floating and kicking.
meanings.sent3: Her attempt at juggling the rudiments of jiu-jitsu was comical.
meanings.sent4: The rudiments of painting can be compared to mixing colors on a palette.
meanings.sent5: The coach emphasized the rudiments of teamwork to the young athletes.
